Macron presses PM Lecornu to secure a budget for France
byline: By Olivier Pérou, Marie Pouzadoux and Nathalie Segaunes
subhed: A special budgetary bill was put forward in a cabinet meeting on December 22, and is expected to be adopted by parliament on Tuesday. Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu is still seeking a majority to pass the budget bill, though the right has encouraged him to force it through in January 2026.

With the assassination of a third Russian senior officer, the military suffers high-ranking losses
subhed: Russian investigators suspect that Ukrainian secret services were behind the car bomb attack that killed Lieutenant General Fanil Sarvarov. In 2024, Vladimir Putin called another senior officer's murder a 'serious failure.'

title: 2025 was the year AI-generated videos flooded social media
subhed: The endless streams of millions of videos generated by artificial intelligence on Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, X, Facebook and beyond have become inescapable. And users want more.

title: Cambodia-Thailand conflict: The poison of nationalism
subhed: The border the two countries share has regularly been a flashpoint for clashes. The persistent conflict has highlighted the limitations of weak multilateralism and the powerlessness of traditional diplomatic tools at a time when force has made a comeback in international relations.

title: From Barbie to Labubu, adults find comfort in collectible figurines
subhed: The craze for Funko Pop! and other Blind Box collectibles has continued to grow, driven by a generation of 'kidults,' adults who embrace their inner child, turning their homes into miniature pop culture museums. Caught between a search for identity, a significant budget and environmental contradictions, this new hobby has become a mainstream phenomenon.

Giorgia Meloni: Neo-fascist or far right? Why Italian PM's tenure raises questions among political experts
subhed: The Italian prime minister has been in power now for three years. Italy's political experts question the normalization of this leader, who comes from a neo-fascist background. Has her tenure really been accompanied by a moderation of her political views?

title: Madagascar's metalheads lead charge of anger: 'It's easier to make yourself heard when you scream'
subhed: After three weeks of protest, Madagascar's Generation Z succeeded in toppling those in power on October 14. The uprising drew much of its strength from countercultural circles, chief among them the island's vibrant metal scene. Heirs to a long tradition, Madagascar's metalheads condemn poverty, inequality and the regime's incompetence.

title: Da Vinci's secret tunnels at Milan's Sforza Castle appear to be nothing more than sewers
subhed: Researchers from the Politecnico di Milano claim to have discovered mysterious underground passages beneath the medieval fortress that match sketches by the Italian master. But historians specializing in the period sharply dispute this theory.
